testcase.brief: Port forwarding for tcp (ssh, ftp, web server, remote desktop ….)
testcase.description:
Topology to use Topo4 Description Port forwarding for tcp (ssh, ftp, web server, remote desktop ….) Platform Dependence BR100,BR200,BRAP330,BRAP350 Pre-condition 1. Wan interface eth0 get ip on br 2. Nat enable on wan interface 3. Pc1 connect to br lan interface and get lan subnet ip address 4. BR100 connect to br lan interface and get lan subnet ip address 5. Pc2 connect to external network on br and pc2 can reach br wan interface Test procedure 1. Configure 1 port forwarding nat policy for ssh tcp on br ip nat-policy ssh type virtual-host inside-host 192.168.1.10 inside-port 22 outside-port 2002 protocol tcp
2. apply the port forwarding nat policy on wan interface interface eth0 mode wan nat-policy ssh
3. pc2 send tcp port 2002 connection to eth0 ip address of br, check result1 4. no the port forwarding on wan interface eth0 , check result 2 no interface eth0 mode wan nat-policy ssh
5. pc2 send tcp port 2002 connection to eth0 ip address of br, again, check result 3 Expect result 1. pc2 connect to br100 ssh server and can manage the br100 through ssh 2. the ssh connection is disconnected on pc2 3. pc2 can’t connect to br100 ssh server and can’t manage the br100 through ssh

step.desc: configure mgt0.1 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "interface mgt0.1 vlan ${br1.vlan1}" -v "interface mgt0.1 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable"

-v "user-profile auto1" -v "user-profile auto1 vlan-id ${br1.vlan1} attribute 1" -v "security-object lan1" -v "security-object lan1 default-user-profile-attr 1" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} mode bridge-access user-profile-attribute 1" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} security-object lan1" -v "int ${br1.br.lan.int1} mac-learning enable"

step.desc: set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
1. Configure 1 port forwarding nat policy for ssh tcp on br
step.telnet: -v "ip nat-policy auto${job.id} type virtual-host inside-host ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} inside-port 22 outside-port 65534 protocol tcp" -v "interface ${br1.br.wan.int1} mode wan nat-policy auto${job.id}"

step.desc: check the nat policy and open debug on br
step.telnet: -v "show ip nat-policy auto${job.id}" -v "_ff id 1 dst-ip ${br.ext_srv.ip} bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail"

step.desc: external PC2 ssh to PC1,ssh should be successful

step.console: -v "no interface ${br1.br.wan.int1} dhcp client" -v "" -v "show ip iptables nat"

step.desc: external PC2 ssh to PC1,ssh should be failed when br wan no ip address
step.log-match: -re -e "(ssh: connect to host ${br1.br.wan.ip} port 65534: Connection refused|SSH failed)"

step.desc: external PC2 ssh to PC1,ssh should be successful after br wan get ip,again
no the port forwarding on wan interface eth0
step.telnet: -v "no interface ${br1.br.wan.int1} mode wan nat-policy auto${job.id}" -v "show ip iptables nat"

step.desc: external PC2 ssh to PC1,ssh should be failed when there are not the port-forwarding nat-policy on the wan interface
step.log-match: -re -e "(ssh: connect to host ${br1.br.wan.ip} port 65534: Connection refused|SSH failed)"
